= Components =
(generated)


*Component items*:
  * *Neck - cutaneous receptors of low neck (neck-low-cutaneous-receptors)*: skin of medial infraclavicular region
  * *Neck - obliquus capitis inferior muscle (neck-obliquus-capitis-inferior-muscle)*: rotation of head and neck
  * *Neck - obliquus capitis superior muscle (neck-obliquus-capitis-superior-muscle)*: extends head and flex head to the ipsilateral side
  * *Neck - rectus capitis posterior major muscle (neck-rectus-capitis-posterior-major-muscle)*: ipsilateral rotation of head and extension
  * *Neck - rectus capitis posterior minor muscle (neck-rectus-capitis-posterior-minor-muscle)*: extends the head at the neck, but is considered to be more of a sensory organ than a muscle
  * *Neck - semispinalis capitis (neck-semispinalis-capitis)*: extend the head
  * *Neck - levator scapulae muscle (neck-levator-scapulae-capitis)*: elevates scapula and tilts its glenoid cavity inferiorly by rotating scapula
  * *Neck - scalenus anterior muscle (neck-scalenus-anterior)*: elevates first rib, rotate the neck to the opposite side
  * *Neck - scalenus medius muscle (neck-scalenus-medius)*: elevate 1st rib, laterally flex (bend) the neck to the same side
  * *Neck - scalenus posterior muscle (neck-scalenus-posterior)*: elevate 2nd rib, tilt the neck to the same side
  * *Neck - longus capitis muscle (neck-longus-capitis)*: flexion of neck at atlanto-occipital joint
  * *Neck - longus colli muscle (neck-longus-colli)*: flexes the neck and head
  * *Neck - rectus capitis anterior muscle (neck-rectus-capitis-anterior)*: flexion of neck at atlanto-occipital joint
  * *Neck - rectus capitis lateralis muscle (neck-rectus-capitis-lateralis)*: sidebend at atlanto-occipital joint, takes care of flexing the neck
  * *Neck - splenius capitis muscle (neck-splenius-capitis)*: prime mover for head extension; can also allow lateral flexion and rotation of the cervical spine
  * *Neck - splenius cervicis muscle (neck-splenius-cervicis)*: bilaterally: extend the head and neck, unilaterally: lateral flexion to the same side, rotation to the same side
  * *Neck - sternocleidomastoid muscle (neck-sternocleidomastoid)*: acting alone, tilts head to its own side and rotates it so the face is turned towards the opposite side; acting together, flexes the neck, raises the sternum and assists in forced inspiration
